text: Hard working Americans are taking the brunt of this lockdown. Many high tech, management, & white collar jobs can work from home. Not true for many blue collar workers. They’re more severely impacted. We've got to get people back to work as soon as possible! Develop plans now!

Q: "Are we being told the truth from the government regarding the origin & everything we know about COVID-19?" 

A: "I believe that the administration & government has been as forth right as possible. Any uncertainty has come from them simply not knowing the facts."

Q: "I am at risk and on social security. Are we still going to be able to get social security?" 

A: "Absolutely. I can promise you that it will be uninterrupted."

Q: "When are we going to lock this down? I see people congregating in groups & not taking this seriously." 

A: "Our state & federal leaders are continuously monitoring the situation. In the meantime, we need to do our part to flatten the curve by practicing social distancing."

If you need to take care of your dependent children for an extended period because of coronavirus, this bill gives you up to 10 weeks of pay.
 
If you are an employer, these costs will be 100% refunded to you by the government through this bill.
If you need to care for a family member, or you care for your dependent children, as a result of the coronavirus, this bill will grant temporary sick leave for 2 weeks.

Millions of Americans work at a small business and don’t have access to paid leave, forcing workers to choose between their paycheck, their health, and the health of the people around them.

If you get sick, this bill will give you two weeks of paid leave.
Earlier this week, Congress passed the Families First Coronavirus Response Act which expands access to emergency paid sick leave to as many as 87 million Americans.
My efforts are focused on ensuring that people are able to care for their families as we all deal with this crisis.

Congress has been hard at work to ensure that the federal government can fully respond to the needs of Americans affected by the coronavirus outbreak. Keep reading to understand what we’ve done so far to protect Americans.

Building off of the package I voted in favor of last week, Congress needs to work together to provide economic relief for our small businesses, hourly workers, and Americans who have lost their jobs.

Freezing people's credit rating: 

- Costs nothing  
- Provides stability
- Truly makes a difference in American households
- Gives people peace of mind
Credit scores should be frozen where they were at the beginning of March and for the duration of this economic crisis. An impact on credit scores can have a negative long-term effect of 7 years.

What acts of service have you seen in your community? 

Use #doinggood to highlight how you & your neighbors are serving others. No act of service is too small!

- Nurse anesthetists in Cedar City are taking an unpaid leave of absence, while elective surgeries are minimized, so their employees can continue to get paid without interruption

-@tooeleschools is providing sack lunches & breakfasts for kids 18 years old & younger who need food

- Grocery stores providing modified hours for elderly/those at higher risk & delivery so they don't have to leave their house 

- A gas station owner is paying employees to pump gas so customers can stay in their cars & not be exposed to germs

I've been amazed by the selfless acts of service that I've seen back home in Utah, proving that together we can & will get through these hard times. A few examples: 

- Facebook groups for people to post what essential items they need & what items they have extra of, to share

The only way we can overcome this obstacle is by doing our part. Be responsible & avoid social gatherings. Find ways to serve others. Make sure your neighbors, especially the elderly and those at risk, have the resources necessary. Stay informed.

https://t.co/qawXMCIiPL

RT @Jim_Jordan: We need serious reforms to the FISA process so that what happened in 2016 cannot happen again in 2020.

This bill makes num…

✅Attorney General must certify ALL FISA applications for elected officials

✅DOJ and FBI must transcribe communications with FISA Court

✅Transcriptions of FISA proceedings so Congress can conduct oversight

✅ Assigns attorney to represent American citizens who are the target of a FISA application

✅Enhanced criminal penalties for lying to FISA Court

✅Access to FISA applications for review by Congress

The surveillance status quo ends today.
